p: A number of theories have been proposed over the years to explain the seasonality of these epidemics [ 7]. These consider that cool and dry surroundings are the reason for this [ 8]. In tropical and subtropical regions the upsurge of influenza has been coupled with precipitation (rain). Epidemics also occur in these regions in other seasons, when the atmospheric conditions are humid and hot [ 4]. In some sub-tropical and tropical regions no significant relation between rainfall and influenza activity has been observed [ 9].
